body: Can we please get a space in the `if (`. Also i think we will want to support returning `false` as well like react does, this will allow `{showOptional || <Column />}`.

I think the functionality is very reasonable, but I would like us to avoid having information "isScrolling" in state of component, because we don't inform render by it in any way, so it may mark the table as needing re-render unnecessarily. Could you please move this to private var?
nit: space between `getAll()` and `{` We should probably setup babel-eslint for that.
:open_mouth: :+1:
nit: space and return type `createFakeRowObjectData(/*number*/ index) /*object*/ {`
space: `) {`
We should probably put a doc block on this file explaining this is dangerous to do for large sizes.
indent looks wrong here, also newline between functions
For components with children put the `>` at the end of the last one so `headerHeight={50}>` here.
Indent these all another level
Single quotes here (we really need lint)
no dot after the `/`
does `background-color` work? It's less specific.
Probably need to cancel raf callback if any.
Or client code should do this as it should call `releaseMouseMoves`.
This is awesome :P

body: @pieterv I initially removed this, but added it back because it saves typing for the developer, if they're going to be using this as an identifier anyway.
nit: add new lines before function declarations in this file.
nit: add empty lines before function declarations.
why not removing this totally?
Do we even need dataKey for column groups? If so, maybe it should be added by user to ColumnGroup instead of us putting just an index there.

We currently use isHeaderCell to
- figure out what data should be passed to cell renderer (shouldn't be problem of the table any more)
- add or not add footer/header css class. (If we wan't people to style the table themselves, maybe adding classes to cells rendered by their components)
  If we were able to remove both these dependencies on "isHeaderCell" we could remove this clone altogether and simplify more :).
The same as "isHeaderCell" comment.
Can we replace ColumnGroup data handling as well and make the api use react components?

body:
I believe that we need to remove ReactComponentWithPureRenderMixin mixin from cell and the rest of hierarchy, because the only thing that we were informing decision about re-rendering is gone now.
We can do one of two things-
- Assume that people will know when to update their renderers, but this will probably be not true for most cases, since not everyone uses flux. We could keep ReactComponentWithPureRenderMixin, or even use static containers in some places...
- Not assume that people want to build stores and dispatching mechanisms for each piece of data and propagate react events properly through the table and never kill them. This will be nicer to people, can be dangerous for perf but we will be able to flatten the react components hierarchy quite a bit and reduce number of dom elements created. Should be able to remove these Impl versions of FixedDataTableRow and CellGroup

I prefer the second solution if we are able to make it fast enough, because it makes the table behave like proper react component that doesn't kill events that should get to its children.
Good idea!
Nope - I forgot that I left that in. I'll remove it!
nit: space before `{`
nit: allPage probably make more sense to be allPages
You could add here that cell will get some additional props from table on top of props you provide. e.g. rowIndex

diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,189 @@
+<!-- File generated from "src/FixedDataTableColumn.react.js" -->
body: This is the old API file, it has been added to the new API (but we dont check those files in)
I have the paragraph above this, do you think we need to repeat it again here?
Would be nice of us to provide an example that shows how to use full flux with table and cells subscribing directly to stores. We should create issue for that.
Yeah that would be nice. I think that would be best as an example rather than part of this page.

Couple of thoughts on this approach:
- Mutating any object is generally bad but in this case we are mutating the DOM node after render which will result in us touching the DOM twice rather than once.
- The other thing is that it wont set any styles for the HTML that gets to the client so before the JS loads the rows will be out of place.
